seo.title: Sora 2 – Generate AI Videos from Text or Image with Sound
seo.description: Create rich AI-generated videos from text or image prompts using Sora 2. Native voice-over, ambient effects, and motion sync via MaxVideoAI.

Multi-beat clips||Shot 1/2/3 prompts work surprisingly well
Rewards structured prompts||shot list > adjective soup
Perfect for rapid iteration||test ideas, pacing, and mood fast
custom.whatTitle: What Sora 2 Actually Is in MaxVideoAI
custom.whatIntro1: On paper, OpenAI Sora 2 is OpenAI’s short-form text-to-video engine. In practice, the way it behaves for you depends on how it’s integrated.
custom.whatIntro2: In MaxVideoAI, Sora 2 is exposed as a focused, production-ready engine:
custom.whatFlowTitle: MaxVideoAI wraps all of this in a simple flow:
whatFlowSteps: 2. Choose Text → Video or Image → Video.
5. See the final price per clip before you generate.
6. Compare against other engines in the same GUI.
custom.specNote: These specs describe Sora 2 exactly as you can use it today via MaxVideoAI – not theoretical capabilities.

specSections.title: Duration & Output
items: Need 1080p? Switch to Sora 2 Pro in the same interface.

specSections.title: Aspect Ratios
items: Both are supported in Text→Video and Image→Video.

specSections.title: Inputs & File Types
items: Text prompts – short, cinematic descriptions in one to three sentences
Reference images – PNG, JPG, WebP, GIF, AVIF up to ~50 MB
No video input in this configuration: you start either from text or from a still image.

specSections.title: Audio
items: Sora 2 returns a video with audio – useful if you want a self-contained clip straight out of the engine.
If you want to control or replace the sound: mute or swap the track in your editor, or use Sora 2 Pro, which exposes an audio toggle in the UI.

specSections.title: Pricing
items: Sora 2 uses a simple per-second pricing model:
No monthly subscription: top up a wallet and only pay for what you generate.

custom.specValueProp: Key value proposition: Sora 2 in MaxVideoAI is the fastest way to test ideas, prototypes and social concepts – you get studio-style motion & sound at a predictable cost per second.

custom.promptTitle: How to Write a Good Sora 2 Prompt
custom.promptIntro: Sora 2 works best when you treat your prompt like a concise shot list rather than a random wishlist of adjectives.
promptPatternSteps: Subject and action – who/what and what they’re doing
Environment – where it happens (office, street, café, studio…)
Camera – how we see it (wide shot, medium shot, close-up, over-the-shoulder…)
Movement – how the camera moves (slow dolly-in, handheld, pan, drone-like…)
Light & mood – golden hour, soft daylight, neon night, high contrast, moody…
Format & duration – mention 16:9 or 9:16 and whether it’s a 4, 8 or 12 second moment
custom.promptSkeleton: Wide shot of [subject] in [environment], lit by [lighting], camera [movement], 8 seconds, 16:9, cinematic, natural colors.
custom.promptSkeletonNote: Drop that into MaxVideoAI, choose Sora 2, and you’re off.
custom.imageTitle: Image-to-Video Workflow with Sora 2 (+ Nano Banana)
custom.imageIntro: One advantage of Sora in MaxVideoAI is pairing it with an image engine like Nano Banana.
imageFlow: Generate a reference frame in Nano Banana that matches your brand style or idea.
Send that still into Sora 2 as Image → Video.
Give Sora a prompt that focuses on motion and timing: how the camera should move, what the subject should do, how the shot should end at 4/8/12 seconds.
Generate, review, tweak just the motion language if needed, regenerate.
imageWhy: Product shots that must stay on-brand
Short looping scenes for ads or UI backgrounds
custom.multishotTitle: Multi-Shot & Sequenced Clips – The Sora 2 “Mini-Film” Trick
custom.multishotIntro1: Sora 2 can interpret multi-step prompts and compress several shots into a single 8 or 12 second clip.
custom.multishotIntro2: With “First… then… finally…” or clear Shot 1/2/3 structure, it stages the clip as a sequence of beats.
multishotTips: Aim for 2–3 shots maximum in one clip.
Give each shot one main action and one clear camera move.
Reuse key elements (same subject, same setting, consistent lighting).
Avoid jumping through five different locations in 8 seconds—keep it focused.
demoPrompt: 8 second cinematic lifestyle commercial of a man in his 30s using a sleek smartwatch while jogging at sunrise in an urban park.
Shot 1 (2 s): close-up of the watch on his wrist, sunlight reflecting off the glass as he adjusts the strap.
Shot 2 (4 s): side-angle tracking shot as he runs along the path, warm light flaring behind skyscrapers.
Shot 3 (2 s): close-up of him glancing at the screen, subtle smile, breath visible in cool morning air.
Lighting: golden hour, cinematic natural tones.
Audio: rhythmic ambient footsteps + faint upbeat music.
Camera: dynamic handheld tracking, 50 mm lens look.
Negative: no logos, no slow-motion, no text overlays.
demoNotes: Shows shot transitions, consistent environment and props, clear camera motion in each segment, and a complete story beat in under 10 seconds.
Use the same 3-beat structure for skincare, SaaS, fitness, or any micro-story.
strengths: Film-like camera behavior (dolly, pan, handheld, etc.)
Great for UGC-feeling footage and cinematic inserts
boundaries: Outputs are 720p, not 1080p – Sora 2 Pro covers higher resolution.
It’s 4–12 seconds, not long-form. Stitch multiple clips for longer edits.
No video input; start from text or image.
No seeds; iterate by refining the prompt and re-running.
Can struggle with very small or detailed text.
custom.tipsFooter: When you understand this and write prompts accordingly, Sora 2 becomes a predictable tool instead of a slot machine.
safetyRules: Do not generate real people or public figures (no celebrities, politicians, etc.).
No minors, sexual content, hateful content or graphic violence.
Don’t use another person’s likeness without consent.
Some prompts and input images will be blocked if they violate these principles.
Generic characters and scenes are fine.
Famous people or sensitive prompts may be blocked.
This is how both MaxVideoAI and Sora 2 stay usable and safe for professionals.
custom.comparisonTitle: Sora 2 vs Sora 2 Pro – Quick Overview
comparisonPoints: Sora 2 is your fast 720p idea machine.
Sora 2 Pro is your higher-resolution, more controllable sibling.
Storyboard with Sora 2, then regenerate finals in Sora 2 Pro with 1080p and audio control.
custom.comparisonCta: Start with Sora 2, move to Sora 2 Pro when you’re ready for 1080p →

faqs.q: Is Sora 2 available in Europe / the UK?
faqs.a: Yes. Use Sora 2 from Europe, the UK and most locations where our service is available—no direct OpenAI invite needed.
This tier outputs 720p. For 1080p, use Sora 2 Pro.
Yes. Upload a PNG/JPG/WEBP/GIF/AVIF frame (up to ~50 MB) and Sora 2 will animate it based on your motion-focused prompt.

faqs.q: Can I remix or extend existing videos with Sora 2?
faqs.a: This configuration is for text→video and image→video only. Combine multiple clips for longer edits.

faqs.q: How do I keep Sora 2 on-brand?
faqs.a: Use image references from Nano Banana or your own design system, mention brand colors, and keep mood consistent across prompts.

custom.finalPara1: Sora 2 in MaxVideoAI gives you a direct, pay-as-you-go way to use one of the most impressive short-form video models available – without infrastructure setup or guesswork.
custom.finalPara2: Use it to explore ideas, build mini-sequences, and test creative directions fast. When you need more resolution or control, you can always step up to Sora 2 Pro.
